title: What are the best books written about Chanakya and his philosophies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Some of the best books to under stand the philosophies (to be more accurate, principles) of Chanakya are written by Shri.B.K. Chaturvedi and Shri.Radhakrishnan Pillai. Radhakrishnan Pillai has authored dozens of books by classifying the principles and explaining the meaning and its relevance in current scenario. Chanakya NeetiB.K.Chaturvedi has authored the book ‘Chanakya Neeti’, which explains the theories of Chanakya in a simple way. Study of the principles of chanakya, helps one in decision making and planning. Its available online and check the reviews given by the readers. 2. Corporate Chanakya ‘Corporate Chanakya’ by Radhakrishnan Pillai, deals with management and corporate governance principles. Radhakrishna Pillai, beautifully explains the the theories of Chanakya in relating to the qualities of a leader, competition, managing people, team work, finance etc. Corporate Chanakya will be most suitable for those doing business and startups. See reviews and get a copy In addition to Corporate Chanakya, Radhakrishnan Pillai has published a book focused on leadership called Corporate Chanakya in Leadership Get a Copy of Corporate Chanakya on Leadership (With CD) and on management called Corporate Chanakya in Management 3. Katha Chanakya Another gem of Radhakrishnan Pillai are ‘Katha Chanakya’. This book is dedicated for those who seeks principles on life and to develop and manage their skills. Principles are explained in simple language and helps one in improving their life. See reviews and get a copy of Katha Chanakya Online 4. Chanakya in You Chanakya in you is another book of Radhakrishnan Pillai. It tells the story of a boy who get to know about Chanakya and Arthashashtra from his grandfather. The boy starts learning and applying the principles of Arthashashtra and narrates the way in which he achieves his goals in life and business by applying the principles in Arthasasthra. Chanakya Neeti by B.K. Chaturvedi: Chanakya Neeti is a book based on Chanakya, an Indian theorist, teacher, philosopher, economist and a noble mentor to the Mauryan emperors between 350 -275 BC. The book portrays about his ideologies and ideas in diverse situations, which are pertinent even to today’s’ times. People follow his ideas to escape from the web of several evils to lead a happy and peaceful life. Chanakya was also known as Kautilya or Vishnu Gupta. He was prominent lecturer at the ancient Takshashila University. He was an expert of economics and political science. Besides teaching, he also advised the Mauryan kings, Chandragupta and his son Bindusara. Chanakya played a crucial role in the establishment and expansion of the Mauryan Empire. In this book, the author tells about Arthashastra, the ancient thesis about Indian Polity. The book focuses on Chanakya’s detailed theories. He wrote his discoveries as to the manner people used to live their lives in ancient India. The book explains the behaviours and patterns a person should follow with different people in life. This book was published in 2002 and is available in paperback form. It comprises of Neeti Sutras in Sanskrit, which are in concise form, but are very impressive. Their translation is done in English and a bit is explained in laymen’s terms too.
